intro: Dictyocalyx multivalvis, commonly known as the many-valved calyx plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive calyx, which consists of multiple valvular structures that open during flowering. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a unique arrangement of petals and stamens. The species is of interest to botanists due to its specialized morphology and ecological adaptations.
